instructions:
Wash, halve and remove seeds and white membrane from green peppers leaving a clean shell. Place in
boiling salted water and boil for 3 minutes or until tender but still firm. Drain and set aside.
Sauté chopped onion and pepper with drippings in a large frying pan for about 5 minutes. Add ground
beef and break up and brown. Stir in seasoning mix, water, and simmer for 5 minutes. Add salsa, beans and
corn and simmer for about 10 minutes.
Fill pepper halves mounding slightly. *(At this point they may be wrapped in foil and frozen.)* Place
stuffed peppers in a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with crushed Fritto crumbs. Add 1 tbsp of water to
baking dish and bake in a 375 F oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and have sour
cream available.

If frozen, thaw, add 1 tbsp water to bottom of baking pan, heat in 400 F oven wrapped in foil for 20
minutes. Unwrap, sprinkle with crushed Fritto crumbs and continue baking in 400 F oven for an additional
23 to 25 minutes.
ingredients: 1 pkg Old El Paso Taco seasoning mix
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans in chili sauce
name: Stuffed Peppers Mexican Style
creator: Jim Decker
